Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the number of meetings that Hillary Clinton had with major contributors to the Clinton Foundation by stating that "more than half" of her meetings were with such donors.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence to support the assertion that "more than half" of Clinton's meetings were with major contributors to the Clinton Foundation.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that meetings with major contributors to the Clinton Foundation automatically imply corruption or wrongdoing.
Exist alternative explanation: There could be alternative explanations for why Clinton had meetings with major contributors, such as discussing philanthropic initiatives or policy matters unrelated to the foundation.
